intro: Ainsliaea daheishanensis, commonly known as the Daheishan ainsliaea, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in the summer months. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
